title: Cru Large Group!
description:
Cru is a caring community passionate about connecting people to Jesus Christ!  Join us in learning together on Who Christ is, building a personal relationship with Him, and joining a community filled with love and open arms!  
 This semester we will be focusing on the theme: "The Fruits of the Spirit". We pray that our students will learn about the Fruits of the Spirit in the Bible and be able to bear good fruit in their walk with God.  
 " And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.   And awe came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.   And all who believed were together and had all things in common.   And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need.   And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they received their food with glad and generous hearts,  praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved." - Acts 2:42-47

title: Database Research Strategies and Advanced Search Tips
description:
Learn some practical ways to increase the effectiveness of your database searches. As databases have become larger, searching has actually become more difficult to do well without knowing more about how these databases are being developed and managed today. We’ll discuss using Boolean searching tools to manipulate search results, how to engage with database thesauri and a controlled vocabulary, linked subject headings, setting up search alerts, and more. 
 Register Here:  https://montclair.libcal.com/event/15416522

title: Crash-A-Class Fall 2025
description:
Ever wonder what it's like in that class everyone's been talking about? Curious about what you'll learn in different majors across campus? You're in luck! 
   
 Running  Monday, October 13 through Friday, October 17 ,  "Crash-A-Class"  is the perfect opportunity to experience and explore different courses you may consider taking in the future and with Fall 2025 Registration  right around the corner , there's no better time to try!  
   
 LINK WILL BE ADDED HERE ONCE SIGN UPS OPEN 
   
 "Crash-a-Class" is an exclusive opportunity for students to sit in on a class for a day to learn more about specific programs from a seat  right inside  the classroom! Held just before spring registration, this program offers students a chance to try out a class  before  registering for it for the coming semester! Like what you've learned? Consider trying out another course in the same subject or speaking with your academic advisor to learn more about adding it to your academic plan!  
   
 "Crash-a-Class" is a free program hosted by University College in collaboration with all of the unrestricted, undergraduate Colleges and Schools on campus. There is no fee or penalty to attend or participate. Students participating in "Crash-a-Class"  will not be excused from their regularly scheduled classes  to attend a course they've registered to "crash."

title: Teaching Italian Symposium XVIII: Toolkit italiano: Building Innovative Pathways to Success
organization: College of Humanities and Social Sciences (CHSS)
description:
The 18th annual professional development program organized by the Coccia Institute for the Italian Experience in America and Prof.ssa Enza Antenos, Dept. of World Languages & Cultures, at Montclair State University. This year’s event will be held on  Friday, October 17, 9:00 am-3:30 pm , in the University Hall Conference Center (7th Floor) at Montclair State University. The annual unveiling of the national Coccia-Inserra Award for Excellence and Innovation in the Teaching of Italian (K-12) will be presented on this occasion. 
 The  registration  fee will be $80 for teachers of Italian and $30 for graduate students/prospective teachers. Registration fee includes Luncheon and Parking. 
 We are looking forward to welcoming back past attendees and greeting new members of the teaching community! Please go ahead and  register  even if you have not as yet received formal authorization from your school district/Board of Ed – we understand that it takes time! 
 REGISTER TODAY! 
 If any questions arise, please do not hesitate to contact Mark Rotella, the Director of the Coccia Institute for the Italian Experience in America, at rotellam@montclair.edu or Cristina Latino, Program Coordinator of the Coccia Institute, at latinoc@montclair.edu.

title: RA+P and Residence Life Coffee House Night
description:
Coffeehouse is our live music event where students can sign up to perform in Russ Lounge. Whether you’re playing, singing, or just coming to hang out, it’s always a great night of creativity and community. 
   
 The goal of the event is to turn Russ Lounge into a performance space that can accommodate an audience, but it’s also a hands-on opportunity to learn how to set up a performance from start to finish. We will be mixing on a Midas M32R, so it's also an opportunity to learn how digital mixers for live audio work. All that prep work culminates in a show featuring Montclair State students from 7 PM to 9:15 PM. We go through the process of setup, performance, and breakdown. IF this interests you, please fill out  this form  for more information on how to join the crew. 
   
 For those interested in performing in the upcoming coffeehouse, we implore you to fill out  this google form , all applicants will receive an email with the setlist once all responses have been sent out! 
   
 See you soon, stay groovy!! 
   
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in a with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Abandoned Jungle Habitat Hike
description:
Join us on a walk through an abandoned Jungle Habitat that was owned by the Warner Bros. located in West Milford, NJ. This habitat opened in the summer of 1972 and closed in the fall of 1976. During the time this place was open there was a drive through safari where it was typical animals would go on top of cars. There were also times where animals would escape their enclosure or cause injury. Walk around areas that have old enclosures for animals and see what is left of the habitat! 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Registration Opens on Fusion on September 22, 2025. 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center’s main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturday, October 18, 2025 
 10:00 am – 5:00 pm 
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, weather appropriate clothing, boots or sneakers, and sunscreen. 
 Potential Hazards:  Poisonous plants/allergies; insect bites; unpredictable weather changes; sunburn/heat exhaustion; dehydration; steep, rocky and/or slippery terrain; rolling or falling rocks; snakes and large animals; and injuries including sprains/strains, abrasions, lacerations and fractures.

 The Hermanos Of La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity Inc., are hosting a special empanada sale to raise funds for our Spring 2025 scholarship and The Florence Immigrant & Refugee Rights Project. Every bite helps make a difference! 
 🥟 What’s on the menu? 
 
 
 Beef Empanadas 
 
 
 Chicken Empanadas 
 
 
 Cheese Empanadas 
 
 
   
 💵 Price: $3 each or $5 for 2 
 Come hungry, bring your friends, and help us reach our fundraising goal—one empanada at a time! 
 The Hermanos Of La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity Inc.

title: Free Swim Lessons - Intermediate
description:
Take your swimming to the next level! Get introduced to new strokes or work on the ones you already know. These lessons are for swimmers who are a little more comfortable in the water but still want to improve their technique and expand what skills they know.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Swimming unassisted on your front and back  
 Improve treading (in the deep end) 
 Improving breath control in the water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Dolphin Kick) 
 Introduction to and/or improving your breaststroke 
 Swimming laps 
 Introduction to open and flip turns 
 Introduction to Butterfly 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Mondays, 1-2 p.m and 5-6 p.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Montclair Unraveled General Body Meeting!!!
description:
Do you want to learn a new knitting or crochet pattern? Do you want to make a cool craft but can't pick one or figure out where to start? Then come to the Montclair Unraveled!  
 Join us and learn how to make something new like accessories, decor, or plushies! Already have something you're working on? Feel free to make some progress here! All are welcome, whether you have the most craft experience possible or none at all. Come by and enjoy the company of others who share your passions for the fiber arts!

title: Cultural Competency in Psychology
description: Step into the world of  cultural competency  a must-have skill for anyone pursuing psychology or a helping profession. This event will dive into how beliefs, customs, and values shape people’s lives, and how future practitioners can better serve diverse communities with respect and understanding. With insight from a guest speaker, you’ll gain practical knowledge and perspectives that will prepare you to work effectively across cultures and grow as both a student and a professional.

title: Free Swim Lessons *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Monday: 9-10AM and 5-6PM 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Montclair State University Wing Chun Club Training
organization: Montclair State University Wing Chun Club
description: The practicing and learning of Wing Chun, a martial art that originated in China over two hundred years ago. In this training individuals will learn this martial art, build up relationships with other members in class, and gain a deeper appreciation for this aspect of Chinese culture. Training sessions will typically include learning of forms, learning fundamentals of movement, incorporating said fundamental motions into various drills.

title: Montclair State University Wing Chun Club Training
organization: Montclair State University Wing Chun Club
description: The practicing and learning of Wing Chun, a martial art that originated in China over two hundred years ago. In this training individuals will learn this martial art, build up relationships with other members in class, and gain a deeper appreciation for this aspect of Chinese culture. Training sessions will typically include learning of forms, learning fundamentals of movement, incorporating said fundamental motions into various drills.

title: Apple Picking
description:
Join us at Wightman Farms for a day at the orchard in the beautiful fall weather. There is a farm market which has salads, sandwiches, prepared foods, fresh produce, farm baked goods, cider, and ice cream. Bring money if you plan to buy apples that you picked. 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Please register on  Fusion , or in the Student Rec Center main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 Registration Opens on Fusion on September 22, 2025. 
 Saturday, October 25, 2025 
 10:00a.m. – 4:00 p.m. 
 Begins Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring:  Water, Lunch, Sneakers, and Sunblock. 
 Potential Hazards:  unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration, allergic reactions/poisonous plants, insect bites, injury by running including sprains, lacerations, abrasions and fractures.

title: Free Swim Lessons - *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Mondays, 9-10 a.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Ballot Guide Pop-Up: Know Before You Vote!
description:
Not sure what’s on the ballot this November? We’ve got you covered! Stop by our  Ballot Guide Pop-Up  to get clear, nonpartisan information about the upcoming election and what you can expect to see when you vote. 
   
 Learn about local races, statewide initiatives, and key issues that directly impact your community. Whether you’re a first-time voter or just need a quick refresher, our team will be on hand to answer your questions and walk you through the ballot in a simple, stress-free way. 
   
 This is your chance to feel confident and prepared before heading to the polls. Grab a guide, ask your questions, and empower yourself to make informed choices on Election Day!

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Skills for Success: The Truth About Soft Skills
description:
Think success in college and beyond is all about technical know-how? Think again! This interactive workshop uncovers the real power of soft skills—like communication, teamwork, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and adaptability—that employers and professors alike value most. Through hands-on activities and real-world examples, you’ll learn how to recognize, strengthen, and showcase these essential skills to thrive as a student and future professional. 
 Event Details:  📅 Date: Tuesday, October 28, 2025 🕒 Time: 1 - 2 pm 📍 Location: Susan A. Cole Hall, Suite 340 (3rd Floor) 
 Presented by the University College Academic Programming Team

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Food Recovery Network General Body Meeting
description:
We’re thrilled to invite you to our General Body Meetings! This is a fantastic opportunity to get involved, meet fellow members, and learn about the exciting plans and initiatives we have in store. 
 - Get to know the team, hear about our mission, and understand the goals and vision for this year. We’ll also introduce key members and roles within the organization. 
 - Learn about upcoming events, projects, and opportunities for involvement. We'll outline our plans and how you can contribute to our success. 
 - Connect with other members, make new friends, and build relationships within our community.  
 - Find out how you can volunteer, join committees, or participate in special projects. We’ll provide information on various roles and how you can make an impact. 
 Whether you’re a new member or a returning one, your presence and participation will help shape the future of our organization.  
 We look forward to meeting you and embarking on this exciting journey together!

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Fireside Chats
description:
Hang out and have casual conversations about anything and everything with other students while enjoying refreshments! Join us on Thursdays from 3:15-4:15pm.  
 What are Fireside Chats: 
 
 A space for students to meet, connect, and have a casual conversation about a given topic, or anything else that feels comfortable for everyone else. It can be about the school climate, student life in general, or your favorite show. All students are welcome!

description: SLAM General Body Meetings are open to all undergraduate students at  Montclair State University and Bloomfield College  who are interested in getting involved. General Body Meetings are also a chance for students to share their ideas, contribute to event planning, and build community on campus. Attending regularly helps volunteers stay informed and gain priority for event participation and leadership opportunities throughout the year.

title: Franken PR Crisis Comms Workshop
organization: Public Relations Student Society of America
description: Join us for an engaging  Crisis Management Workshop  where you'll learn how to navigate high-pressure situations and protect a brand’s reputation during a crisis. This session will cover key principles of effective crisis response, communication strategies, and decision-making under stress. Participants will take part in a hands-on  PR statement activity , where you’ll craft and present a public response to a simulated crisis scenario. This interactive exercise will help build your confidence, sharpen your messaging skills, and prepare you for real-world challenges in media and public relations.

title: Cru Large Group!
description:
Cru is a caring community passionate about connecting people to Jesus Christ!  Join us in learning together on Who Christ is, building a personal relationship with Him, and joining a community filled with love and open arms!  
 This semester we will be focusing on the theme: "The Fruits of the Spirit". We pray that our students will learn about the Fruits of the Spirit in the Bible and be able to bear good fruit in their walk with God.  
 " And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.   And awe came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.   And all who believed were together and had all things in common.   And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need.   And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they received their food with glad and generous hearts,  praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved." - Acts 2:42-47

title: Free Swim Clinic - Butterfly
description:
Take your swimming to the next level! Do you have a specific skill you really want to work on but never had the chance to, or that you have been meaning to learn? Each clinic will have its own topic to work on and really be able to go in-depth on. Skills include treading, flip turns, sprints, starts, and more.

title: “Sweatober" Challenge Month
description:
Are you ready to commit to your goals, try something new, and earn rewards while you sweat? All October long, we’re turning up the energy with Sweatober—a month-long group fitness challenge designed to keep you moving, motivated, and having fun.  
 Here’s how it works: Attend group fitness classes throughout the month (like Zumba, Kickboxing, Yoga, HIIT, Pilates, Cycling, and more!) and collect points or stamps on your Sweatober Passport. The more you move, the more you earn! Plus, this is a judgment-free zone: no matter your fitness level, our instructors and community are here to cheer you on. It’s not about being perfect, it’s about showing up for yourself! 
 Let October be the month you commit to YOU. One class at a time. 
 When:  October 1-31 (month-long) 
 Where:  Student Recreation Center, MP1 and MP2 (Locations depend on the fall group x schedule) 
 Who:  Montclair Students Drop-in is welcomed!

title: Open Mic & Mocktails
description:
Whether you're a poet, musician, comedian, or just love a good vibe, this is your moment to shine! Join us for  Open Mic Night  — a laid-back evening filled with talent, creativity, and campus community. Take the mic or sit back and enjoy the show as your fellow Red Hawks share their voices. 
 And while you’re soaking in the sounds, sip on a variety of  free mocktails  crafted to match the mood — because nothing pairs better with live performances than a sweet treat. 
 How do I sign up? 
 
 Early registration is not required 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 All students are welcome! 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturday, November 1st 
 7 pm - 9 pm 
 Student Center, The Underground, Room 160

title: Lakota Wolf Preserve
description:
We will enjoy a ½ mile nature walk in Columbia, NJ to a preserve, where we will be invited into an observation area surrounded by 4 packs of wolves! We will also get the opportunity to observe Lakota’s foxes, bobcats, and lynx! 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through Fusion, in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10 
 
   
 Where and when? 
 
 Sunday, November 2, 2025 
 1:00 pm - 5:30 pm 
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
   
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, long pants, sneakers, and sunscreen. 
   
 Potential Hazards:  Unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration, allergic reactions/poisonous plants, insect bites and injury by running, including sprains, lacerations, abrasions and fractures.

title: Free Swim Lessons - *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Mondays, 9-10 a.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

description:

 Cheese Empanadas

description:
Do you want to learn a new knitting or crochet pattern? Do you want to make a cool craft but can't pick one or figure out where to start? Then come to the Montclair Unraveled!

All are welcome, whether you have the most craft experience possible or none at all. Come by and enjoy the company of others who share your passions for the fiber arts!

title: First Gen Drop-In Group
description:
This is a support drop-in group for first generation college students aimed to help ensure that first-gen students are empowered and prepared to reach their full social, professional, and academic potential. Students will have opportunities to build community, empower and support one another through shared experiences with topics that may include, but not limited to, lack of knowledge about college experience/resources, imposter syndrome, financial and family stress, academic struggles and other challenging subject matters. 
 Group Meets: 
 
 First group will be held on September 9, 2025 
 On Tuesdays from 11:30am – 12:30pm in the Health Promotion Drop-In Center 
 
 For more information, contact group leaders Ms. Charisma Jackson, LCSW at  jacksoncha@montclair.edu

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: CALI SCHOOL OF MUSIC: Brass Night 2
description:

title: Black Metal Film Screening
description:
This special screening of the film adaptation of  Black Metal  is followed by a discussion with artist and curator Ari Melenciano. 
 
 
 ABOUT THE EXHIBITION Segal Gallery and Kasser Lobby September 23 – December 14, 2025 
 Black Metal  originated as a kitchen table art book that pushes the boundaries of space travel, science fiction, speculative design, Black culture, art, technology, and spirituality. The book emerged from an Afrotectopia-led incubator, in collaboration with MIT Media Lab’s Space Exploration Initiative and NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program. The project features contributions from artists Jordan Caldwell, Kordae Jatafa Henry, Jeremy Kamal, and Ari Melenciano. 
 The Age of Black Metal  builds upon the foundational ideas of the book and translates the text into a fully immersive experience for visitors to explore each conceptual chapter–from metaphysical training manuals, botanical consciousness, and self-alignment protocols–through participatory installations. The exhibition is set centuries in the future, imagining a timeline where society has been profoundly shaped by the principles of Black Metal. Ultimately, visitors will not only bear witness to the societal effects of Black Metal, but also leave transformed in some way.

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Fireside Chats

 What are Fireside Chats:

title: Cru Large Group!
description:
Cru is a caring community passionate about connecting people to Jesus Christ!  Join us in learning together on Who Christ is, building a personal relationship with Him, and joining a community filled with love and open arms!  
 This semester we will be focusing on the theme: "The Fruits of the Spirit". We pray that our students will learn about the Fruits of the Spirit in the Bible and be able to bear good fruit in their walk with God.  
 " And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.   And awe came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.   And all who believed were together and had all things in common.   And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need.   And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they received their food with glad and generous hearts,  praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved." - Acts 2:42-47

title: Horseback Riding Trip
description:
Learn horseback riding basics at the Echo Lakes Stable. We'll go on a gorgeous trail ride through beautiful fields and trails that follow  the path next to mountain sides with swiftly running streams. NOTE: WEIGHT LIMIT 225lb 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $20 
 
   
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturday, November 8th, 2025 
 9:30 a.m. - 3 p.m. 
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
   
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, long pants, sneakers/boots and sunscreen. 
 Potential Hazards:  Unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration, allergic reactions/poisonous plants, insect bites and injury by running, including sprains, lacerations, abrasions and fractures, injuries by animal including bites, falls from height and injuries from hooves including kicks and steps.

title: South Mountain Preserve Easy Hike (Fairy Hike)
description:
Get ready to frolic amongst the fairies as we go through the South Mountain preserve fairy trail, decorated with woodland creature houses along our beautiful walk through nature. As you join us on this magical hike, make sure to wear comfortable sneakers or hiking shoes and bring a water bottle! 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through Fusion, in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340) . 
 Cost for Students $10 
 
   
 Where and when? 
 
 Sunday, November 9, 2025 
 10:00 am - 5:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
   
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, weather appropriate clothing, boots or sneakers, and sunscreen. 
 Potential Hazards:  Poisonous plants/allergies; insect bites; unpredictable weather changes; sunburn/heat exhaustion; dehydration; steep, rocky and/or slippery terrain; rolling or falling rocks; snakes and large animals; and injuries including sprains/strains, abrasions, lacerations and fractures.

title: Free Swim Lessons - *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Mondays, 9-10 a.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

description:

 Swimming unassisted on your front and back

description:
Do you want to learn a new knitting or crochet pattern? Do you want to make a cool craft but can't pick one or figure out where to start? Then come to the Montclair Unraveled!

All are welcome, whether you have the most craft experience possible or none at all. Come by and enjoy the company of others who share your passions for the fiber arts!

title: First Gen Drop-In Group
description:
This is a support drop-in group for first generation college students aimed to help ensure that first-gen students are empowered and prepared to reach their full social, professional, and academic potential. Students will have opportunities to build community, empower and support one another through shared experiences with topics that may include, but not limited to, lack of knowledge about college experience/resources, imposter syndrome, financial and family stress, academic struggles and other challenging subject matters. 
 Group Meets: 
 
 First group will be held on September 9, 2025 
 On Tuesdays from 11:30am – 12:30pm in the Health Promotion Drop-In Center 
 
 For more information, contact group leaders Ms. Charisma Jackson, LCSW at  jacksoncha@montclair.edu

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: SA Awareness & Prevention with the Sisters of  Phi Sigma Sigma & Theta Phi Alpha
location: University Hall 1070 - Phyllis & Gerald LeBoff Lecture Hall
description:
Join the sisters of Phi Sigma Sigma and Theta Phi Alpha for an important evening focused on sexual assault awareness, prevention, and empowerment. This collaborative event is dedicated to fostering a safe, supportive, and informed campus community. 
 Through educational resources and guest speakers. Attendees will gain valuable insights into consent, bystander intervention, and how to support survivors. Our goal is to create a space for open dialogue, learning, and collective action against sexual violence. 
 Whether you're seeking knowledge, resources, or ways to get involved, this event welcomes all students to be part of the conversation and the movement toward a safer community!

title: Food Recovery Network General Body Meeting
description:
We’re thrilled to invite you to our General Body Meetings! This is a fantastic opportunity to get involved, meet fellow members, and learn about the exciting plans and initiatives we have in store. 
 - Get to know the team, hear about our mission, and understand the goals and vision for this year. We’ll also introduce key members and roles within the organization. 
 - Learn about upcoming events, projects, and opportunities for involvement. We'll outline our plans and how you can contribute to our success. 
 - Connect with other members, make new friends, and build relationships within our community.  
 - Find out how you can volunteer, join committees, or participate in special projects. We’ll provide information on various roles and how you can make an impact. 
 Whether you’re a new member or a returning one, your presence and participation will help shape the future of our organization.  
 We look forward to meeting you and embarking on this exciting journey together!

title: Design Your Day - Discover Your Direction
description:
Not sure what to major in or where you're headed after college? Let’s change that—starting with the kind of  day  you want to have. In this hands-on, creative workshop, you’ll: 
  1) Visualize your ideal workday—where you are, who you’re with, and what you’re doing.  
 2) Identify your key work-life preferences, like flexibility, collaboration, or creativity.  
 3) Explore majors and careers that align with your vision through UC’s AI-powered  Major Mentor , a tool that matches your preferences to Montclair majors and career paths.

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Fireside Chats
description:
Hang out and have casual conversations about anything and everything with other students while enjoying refreshments! Join us on Thursdays from 3:15-4:15pm.  
 What are Fireside Chats: 
 
 A space for students to meet, connect, and have a casual conversation about a given topic, or anything else that feels comfortable for everyone else. It can be about the school climate, student life in general, or your favorite show. All students are welcome!

title: SLAM General Body Meeting
description: SLAM General Body Meetings are open to all undergraduate students at  Montclair State University and Bloomfield College  who are interested in getting involved. These meetings are a space for volunteers and members to connect, hear important updates from the Executive Board, and learn about upcoming events and opportunities. General Body Meetings are also a chance for students to share their ideas, contribute to event planning, and build community on campus. Attending regularly helps volunteers stay informed and gain priority for event participation and leadership opportunities throughout the year.

title: Cru Large Group!
description:
Cru is a caring community passionate about connecting people to Jesus Christ!  Join us in learning together on Who Christ is, building a personal relationship with Him, and joining a community filled with love and open arms!  
 This semester we will be focusing on the theme: "The Fruits of the Spirit". We pray that our students will learn about the Fruits of the Spirit in the Bible and be able to bear good fruit in their walk with God.  
 " And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.   And awe came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.   And all who believed were together and had all things in common.   And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need.   And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they received their food with glad and generous hearts,  praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved." - Acts 2:42-47

title: RA+P and Residence Life Coffee House Night
description:
Coffeehouse is our live music event where students can sign up to perform in Russ Lounge. Whether you’re playing, singing, or just coming to hang out, it’s always a great night of creativity and community. 
   
 The goal of the event is to turn Russ Lounge into a performance space that can accommodate an audience, but it’s also a hands-on opportunity to learn how to set up a performance from start to finish. We will be mixing on a Midas M32R, so it's also an opportunity to learn how digital mixers for live audio work. All that prep work culminates in a show featuring Montclair State students from 7 PM to 9:15 PM. We go through the process of setup, performance, and breakdown. IF this interests you, please fill out  t his form  for more information on how to join the crew. 
   
 For those interested in performing in the upcoming coffeehouse, we implore you to fill out  this google form , all applicants will receive an email  with the setlist once all responses have been sent out! 
   
 See you soon, stay groovy!! 
   
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in a with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Indoor Rock Climbing
description:
A perfect trip for all levels of climber -- novice to expert! A pressure-free, safe indoor rock climbing experience at the New Jersey Rock Gym in Fairfield, NJ. Dress to Move! Rental shoes are included in the price. 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through Fusion, in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10 
 
   
 Where and when? 
 
 Sunday, November 16, 2025 
 12:00 pm - 4:00 pm 
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
   
 What to bring:  Water, long pants, sneakers. 
   
 Potential Hazards:  Injuries caused by a fall from a height including abrasions, strains/sprains, and fractures.

title: Free Swim Lessons - *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Mondays, 9-10 a.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Montclair Unraveled General Body Meeting!!!
description:
Do you want to learn a new knitting or crochet pattern? Do you want to make a cool craft but can't pick one or figure out where to start? Then come to the Montclair Unraveled!  
 Join us and learn how to make something new like accessories, decor, or plushies! Already have something you're working on? Feel free to make some progress here! All are welcome, whether you have the most craft experience possible or none at all. Come by and enjoy the company of others who share your passions for the fiber arts!

title: PASO General Board Meeting
description:
Join us every week for our PASO General Board Meetings, where culture, community, and leadership come together! These meetings are open to all members and students interested in learning more about Peruvian culture, supporting Latinx representation, and getting involved. 
 
 
 All Montclair / Bloomfield Campus Students are Invited to Attend!

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall - History Club Crisis Sim and GBM
organization: The Historical Society at Montclair State
description:
Step into one of the most pivotal moments of the Cold War with the History Club! Through a mix of roleplaying, interactive activities, and a short history lesson, you’ll get the chance to experience how key figures shaped global events and influenced the world we live in today. 
 No background knowledge is required! This is a fun and engaging way to dive into history, think critically about big decisions, and explore the human side of world-changing moments. 
 All students are welcome to join, and free pizza will be available to everyone who stops by!

title: First Gen Drop-In Group
description:
This is a support drop-in group for first generation college students aimed to help ensure that first-gen students are empowered and prepared to reach their full social, professional, and academic potential. Students will have opportunities to build community, empower and support one another through shared experiences with topics that may include, but not limited to, lack of knowledge about college experience/resources, imposter syndrome, financial and family stress, academic struggles and other challenging subject matters. 
 Group Meets: 
 
 First group will be held on September 9, 2025 
 On Tuesdays from 11:30am – 12:30pm in the Health Promotion Drop-In Center 
 
 For more information, contact group leaders Ms. Charisma Jackson, LCSW at  jacksoncha@montclair.edu

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Free Swim Lessons *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Wednesday: 2-3PM and 5-6PM 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Free Swim Lessons - Intermediate
description:
Take your swimming to the next level! Get introduced to new strokes or work on the ones you already know. These lessons are for swimmers who are a little more comfortable in the water but still want to improve their technique and expand what skills they know.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Swimming unassisted on your front and back  
 Improve treading (in the deep end) 
 Improving breath control in the water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Dolphin Kick) 
 Introduction to and/or improving your breaststroke 
 Swimming laps 
 Introduction to open and flip turns 
 Introduction to Butterfly 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20 
 Wednesday:11-12 PM and 5-6PM 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Fireside Chats
description:
Hang out and have casual conversations about anything and everything with other students while enjoying refreshments! Join us on Thursdays from 3:15-4:15pm.  
 What are Fireside Chats: 
 
 A space for students to meet, connect, and have a casual conversation about a given topic, or anything else that feels comfortable for everyone else. It can be about the school climate, student life in general, or your favorite show. All students are welcome!

title: SLAM General Body Meeting
description: SLAM General Body Meetings are open to all undergraduate students at  Montclair State University and Bloomfield College  who are interested in getting involved. These meetings are a space for volunteers and members to connect, hear important updates from the Executive Board, and learn about upcoming events and opportunities. General Body Meetings are also a chance for students to share their ideas, contribute to event planning, and build community on campus. Attending regularly helps volunteers stay informed and gain priority for event participation and leadership opportunities throughout the year.

title: Unplugged: Broadway Trivia
description:
Gather your friends and head to 1908 for a night of show-stopping facts, fun questions, and friendly competition at Broadway Trivia Night! Compete for the chance to win awesome prizes — or just come for some pizza, wings, and maybe a few surprises. 
 How do I sign up? 
 
 Early registration is not required 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 All students are welcome! 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Thursday, November 20th 
 7 pm - 9 pm 
 Student Center, 1908 Pizzeria 
 
 Prizes 
 
 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place prizes  for top players tonight! 1st- $20 dining dollars, 2nd- $15 dining dollars, 3rd- $10 dining dollars! 
 Everyone here is also entered for our  weekly door prize , which we’ll give out at the end of the night.  
 
 And don’t forget our  mega raffle at the end of the trivia series  – the more nights you attend, the better your chances of winning something big!

title: Cru Large Group!
description:
Cru is a caring community passionate about connecting people to Jesus Christ!  Join us in learning together on Who Christ is, building a personal relationship with Him, and joining a community filled with love and open arms!  
 This semester we will be focusing on the theme: "The Fruits of the Spirit". We pray that our students will learn about the Fruits of the Spirit in the Bible and be able to bear good fruit in their walk with God.  
 " And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.   And awe came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.   And all who believed were together and had all things in common.   And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need.   And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they received their food with glad and generous hearts,  praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved." - Acts 2:42-47

title: Turtle Back Zoo
description:
Join your friends for a day at the Zoo! See animals from all over the world as you enjoy lunch at your choice of cafes around the park. Bring cash for lunch, a water bottle to stay hydrated, and comfortable walking shoes. 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through Fusion, in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340) . 
 Cost for Students  $10 
 
   
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturday, November 22, 2025 
 10:00 am - 4:00 pm 
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
   
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, long pants, sneakers, and sunscreen.   Participants MUST wear sneakers in order to go on the zipline and obstacle course. 
   
 Note:  Tree Top Adventures restricts obstacle course and zipline participants to a strict weight limit of 250 lbs. Students may opt to participate in only the Zoo portion of the trip should they like. 
 Potential Hazards:  Unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration, allergic reactions/poisonous plants, insect bites and injury by running, including sprains, lacerations, abrasions and fractures.

title: Montclair Unraveled General Body Meeting!!!
description:
Do you want to learn a new knitting or crochet pattern? Do you want to make a cool craft but can't pick one or figure out where to start? Then come to the Montclair Unraveled!  
 Join us and learn how to make something new like accessories, decor, or plushies! Already have something you're working on? Feel free to make some progress here! All are welcome, whether you have the most craft experience possible or none at all. Come by and enjoy the company of others who share your passions for the fiber arts!

title: PASO General Board Meeting
description:
Join us every week for our PASO General Board Meetings, where culture, community, and leadership come together! These meetings are open to all members and students interested in learning more about Peruvian culture, supporting Latinx representation, and getting involved. 
 
 
 All Montclair / Bloomfield Campus Students are Invited to Attend!

title: First Gen Drop-In Group
description:
This is a support drop-in group for first generation college students aimed to help ensure that first-gen students are empowered and prepared to reach their full social, professional, and academic potential. Students will have opportunities to build community, empower and support one another through shared experiences with topics that may include, but not limited to, lack of knowledge about college experience/resources, imposter syndrome, financial and family stress, academic struggles and other challenging subject matters. 
 Group Meets: 
 
 First group will be held on September 9, 2025 
 On Tuesdays from 11:30am – 12:30pm in the Health Promotion Drop-In Center 
 
 For more information, contact group leaders Ms. Charisma Jackson, LCSW at  jacksoncha@montclair.edu

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Montclair Unraveled General Body Meeting!!!
description:
Do you want to learn a new knitting or crochet pattern? Do you want to make a cool craft but can't pick one or figure out where to start? Then come to the Montclair Unraveled!  
 Join us and learn how to make something new like accessories, decor, or plushies! Already have something you're working on? Feel free to make some progress here! All are welcome, whether you have the most craft experience possible or none at all. Come by and enjoy the company of others who share your passions for the fiber arts!

title: PASO General Board Meeting
description:
Join us every week for our PASO General Board Meetings, where culture, community, and leadership come together! These meetings are open to all members and students interested in learning more about Peruvian culture, supporting Latinx representation, and getting involved. 
 
 
 All Montclair / Bloomfield Campus Students are Invited to Attend!

title: SAAC General Body Meeting 12/3/2025
description: The Student-Athlete Advisory Committee at Montclair State University serves as the voice of the student-athlete population. Our meetings provide a space for student-athletes to come together, discuss important issues, share feedback, and collaborate on initiatives that enhance the student-athlete experience on and off the field. We focus on leadership development, community engagement, mental health, academic support, and athletic excellence.

title: Kichwa Language and Culture Workshop Series - 2nd Edition
organization: Center for Latino Heritage & Spanish Language Excellence
description:
After a very successful first edition of our Kichwa Language and Culture classes last spring, we are thrilled to launch a new workshop series starting September 15. This year’s program continues to pair Kichwa language learning with rich cultural experiences: and we’re adding something special. Students will have the opportunity to engage with an acclaimed Indigenous artist, exploring their paintings, the deep connection to nature behind their work, the meaning of colors and subjects, and more. 
 
 Space is limited.  
 Class is starting on Monday, September 15th, every Monday from 5:30pm-7:30pm for the duration of 10 weeks. 
 REGISTRATION IS REQUIRED by contacting Dr. Calarota-Ninman at calarotaa@montclair.edu

title: First Gen Drop-In Group
description:
This is a support drop-in group for first generation college students aimed to help ensure that first-gen students are empowered and prepared to reach their full social, professional, and academic potential. Students will have opportunities to build community, empower and support one another through shared experiences with topics that may include, but not limited to, lack of knowledge about college experience/resources, imposter syndrome, financial and family stress, academic struggles and other challenging subject matters. 
 Group Meets: 
 
 First group will be held on September 9, 2025 
 On Tuesdays from 11:30am – 12:30pm in the Health Promotion Drop-In Center 
 
 For more information, contact group leaders Ms. Charisma Jackson, LCSW at  jacksoncha@montclair.edu

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

description: Learn more about pre-completion and post-completion Optional Practical Training (OPT) for F-1 students. Any student planning to apply for OPT is REQUIRED to attend a workshop before they can apply. This workshop is for CURRENT students ONLY - any other attendees will be removed.

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Fireside Chats
description:
Hang out and have casual conversations about anything and everything with other students while enjoying refreshments! Join us on Thursdays from 3:15-4:15pm.  
 What are Fireside Chats: 
 
 A space for students to meet, connect, and have a casual conversation about a given topic, or anything else that feels comfortable for everyone else. It can be about the school climate, student life in general, or your favorite show. All students are welcome!

title: SLAM General Body Meeting
description: SLAM General Body Meetings are open to all undergraduate students at  Montclair State University and Bloomfield College  who are interested in getting involved. These meetings are a space for volunteers and members to connect, hear important updates from the Executive Board, and learn about upcoming events and opportunities. General Body Meetings are also a chance for students to share their ideas, contribute to event planning, and build community on campus. Attending regularly helps volunteers stay informed and gain priority for event participation and leadership opportunities throughout the year.

description: Ready to refresh your wardrobe? Bring gently used clothes you don’t wear anymore to donate—or swap them for something new-to-you! Swing Phi Swing is all about giving back while keeping it fun. Come for the exchange, discover new styles, and enjoy good vibes!

title: Unplugged: Video Game Trivia
description:
Gather your friends and head to 1908 for a night of fast facts, fun questions, and friendly competition at Video Game Trivia Night!  Compete for the chance to win awesome prizes — or just come for some pizza, wings, and maybe a few surprises. 
 How do I sign up? 
 
 Early registration is not required 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 All students are welcome! 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Thursday, December 4th 
 7 pm - 9 pm 
 Student Center, 1908 Pizzeria 
 
 Prizes 
 
 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place prizes  for top players tonight! 1st- $20 dining dollars, 2nd- $15 dining dollars, 3rd- $10 dining dollars! 
 Everyone here is also entered for our  weekly door prize , which we’ll give out at the end of the night.  
 
 And don’t forget our  mega raffle at the end of the trivia series  – the more nights you attend, the better your chances of winning something big!

title: Cru Large Group!
description:
Cru is a caring community passionate about connecting people to Jesus Christ!  Join us in learning together on Who Christ is, building a personal relationship with Him, and joining a community filled with love and open arms!  
 This semester we will be focusing on the theme: "The Fruits of the Spirit". We pray that our students will learn about the Fruits of the Spirit in the Bible and be able to bear good fruit in their walk with God.  
 " And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.   And awe came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.   And all who believed were together and had all things in common.   And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need.   And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they received their food with glad and generous hearts,  praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved." - Acts 2:42-47

title: RA+P and Residence Life Coffee House Night
description:
Coffeehouse is our live music event where students can sign up to perform in Russ Lounge. Whether you’re playing, singing, or just coming to hang out, it’s always a great night of creativity and community. 
   
 The goal of the event is to turn Russ Lounge into a performance space that can accommodate an audience, but it’s also a hands-on opportunity to learn how to set up a performance from start to finish. We will be mixing on a Midas M32R, so it's also an opportunity to learn how digital mixers for live audio work. All that prep work culminates in a show featuring Montclair State students from 7 PM to 9:15 PM. We go through the process of setup, performance, and breakdown. IF this interests you, please fill out  this form  for more information on how to join the crew. 
   
 For those interested in performing in the upcoming coffeehouse, we implore you to fill out  this google form , all applicants will receive an email  with the setlist once all responses have been sent out! 
   
 See you soon, stay groovy!! 
   
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in a with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Friends Day: Find a Buddy
description:
Register Your Child for Friends Day!  Friends Day is a fun, inclusive event at the MSU Student Recreation Center for individuals with disabilities, ages  5–21 . Your child will be paired with two MSU student Buddies and guided through a variety of exciting activity stations—including games, crafts, and more—all designed to promote creativity, movement, and fun in a supportive environment. Friends Day takes place on  Sunday, December 7 , and you may register your child for  one session only —either the morning or afternoon session. Don’t miss this exciting opportunity for your child to have fun, make friends, and enjoy a memorable day at the Rec! 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 To register, please visit our  website . 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Sunday, December 7, 2025 
 10am – 12pm and 2 – 4pm 
 Student Recreation Center

title: Friends Day: Be a Buddy
description:
Be a Buddy at the Rec!  Volunteer for Friends Day on  Sunday, December 7  at the Student Recreation Center. As a Buddy, you and another MSU student will be paired with a child or young adult to go station-to-station, participate in fun activities and crafts, and help them explore and enjoy the space. You can sign up for  one or both sessions , and  community service hours  will be given. Want to volunteer with a friend? Great! Buddies can sign up together as long as you’re both MSU students. This year’s theme is Nickelodeon, so get ready for a fun-filled day inspired by your favorite characters and shows. Come make a meaningful impact while having fun! 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 To register, please visit our  website . 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Sunday, December 7, 2025 
 10am – 12pm and 2 – 4pm 
 Student Recreation Center

title: First Gen Drop-In Group
description:
This is a support drop-in group for first generation college students aimed to help ensure that first-gen students are empowered and prepared to reach their full social, professional, and academic potential. Students will have opportunities to build community, empower and support one another through shared experiences with topics that may include, but not limited to, lack of knowledge about college experience/resources, imposter syndrome, financial and family stress, academic struggles and other challenging subject matters. 
 Group Meets: 
 
 First group will be held on September 9, 2025 
 On Tuesdays from 11:30am – 12:30pm in the Health Promotion Drop-In Center 
 
 For more information, contact group leaders Ms. Charisma Jackson, LCSW at  jacksoncha@montclair.edu

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Food Recovery Network General Body Meeting
description:
We’re thrilled to invite you to our General Body Meetings! This is a fantastic opportunity to get involved, meet fellow members, and learn about the exciting plans and initiatives we have in store. 
 - Get to know the team, hear about our mission, and understand the goals and vision for this year. We’ll also introduce key members and roles within the organization. 
 - Learn about upcoming events, projects, and opportunities for involvement. We'll outline our plans and how you can contribute to our success. 
 - Connect with other members, make new friends, and build relationships within our community.  
 - Find out how you can volunteer, join committees, or participate in special projects. We’ll provide information on various roles and how you can make an impact. 
 Whether you’re a new member or a returning one, your presence and participation will help shape the future of our organization.  
 We look forward to meeting you and embarking on this exciting journey together!

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Fireside Chats
description:
Hang out and have casual conversations about anything and everything with other students while enjoying refreshments! Join us on Thursdays from 3:15-4:15pm.  
 What are Fireside Chats: 
 
 A space for students to meet, connect, and have a casual conversation about a given topic, or anything else that feels comfortable for everyone else. It can be about the school climate, student life in general, or your favorite show. All students are welcome!

title: SLAM General Body Meeting
description: SLAM General Body Meetings are open to all undergraduate students at  Montclair State University and Bloomfield College  who are interested in getting involved. These meetings are a space for volunteers and members to connect, hear important updates from the Executive Board, and learn about upcoming events and opportunities. General Body Meetings are also a chance for students to share their ideas, contribute to event planning, and build community on campus. Attending regularly helps volunteers stay informed and gain priority for event participation and leadership opportunities throughout the year.
